scrapper

Class Authentifier

  • java.lang.Object
    • scrapper.Authentifier

  • public class Authentifier
extends java.lang.Object
    Implements OAuth2 for a Reddit access. The first time, it retrieves a permanent token (masterToken), via a manual code verification. This token is related to the user of the application, so it must be personal and kept secret. Then, for each use, it generates a temporary token by refreshing the masterToken. Doc at https://github.com/reddit/reddit/wiki/OAuth2
    Author:
    Yohan Chalier

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Authentifier(RedditAPI api)
      The code is stored as its validation is asynchronous.

      • Authentifier

        The code is stored as its validation is asynchronous.
        Parameters:

    • Method Detail

      • auth

        public void auth()
          throws java.lang.Exception
        Tries to refresh the token using the permanent token stored in FILE_TOKEN (by default token_json). To retrieve the token, either the code has been fetched already, in which case we just need to send a request to Reddit, or not, in which case we need to ask for a code.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • retrieveCodeServerIn

        public void retrieveCodeServerIn(java.lang.String code,
                                 java.lang.String seed)
                          throws java.lang.Exception
        Handles the data received by the temporary server when the redirect_uri request happens. The auth() method previously called that executed retrieveCodeServerOut ends when the server closes. So now that we have the code, we need to re-start it to retrieve the token (only if the seed matches)
        Parameters:
        code - The code given by Reddit
        seed - The seed associated with the request, that must match the stored seed.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getToken

        public java.lang.String getToken()
                          throws org.json.JSONException
        A getter that returns only the string necessary to the Reddit API.
        Returns:
        Throws:
        org.json.JSONException
